title: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When the tab character is replaced with spaces in the first line so that the two lines are visually indented the same, and then ShiftLeft is executed, the text moves unexpectedly. This behavior is confusing, as it is unclear why the text won't shift.
EB: After replacing the tab character with spaces in the first line, executing ShiftLeft should shift the second line left and the first line left at least to the space character (i.e., remove the tab). If there is a stray space, it should not prevent the text from shifting.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the two lines are visually indented the same.
2. Perform the ShiftLeft operation.
3. Observe that the second line is shifted left and the first line is shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., remove the tab). Ensure that any stray spaces do not prevent the text from shifting.
